hashbrowns.title: Hashbrowns

ingredients.amount: enough to coat bottom of the pan

steps: Put hot water in the hashbrown box for 8 and a half minutes. Meanwhile coat the bottom of the pan with vegetable oil. Heat the pan up to about halfway on the stovetop.
Strain the water out of the hashbrowns. Then spread them evenly across the preheated pan. Cook them for about 5 minutes or until you can smell them cooking. Meanwhile start the broiler.
Put the pan in the oven for 5 minutes. Then rotate it 180 degrees and leave it like that for 2.5 minutes. Don't let it burn.
Turn off the broiler. Put 5 equally sliced chips of butter on the pan. Then 5 slices of cheese. Put on 3 shakes of trail dust. Then put the pan back in the oven until the cheese is melted.
Then put it on a plate. Fold it in half so the cheese from the last step is on the inside. Then put the last 2 slices on top, and microwave it for 15 seconds.

cookieDough.title: Cookie Dough
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Evenly spread flour on a baking pan with parchment paper or similar. Bake in the oven for 5 minutes, then wait for it to cool completely.
Cream together butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, and salt until pale and fluffy.
Stir in milk and flour.
Mix in chocolate chips.
Refrigerate in the shape you want the finished product to be.

pasta.title: Pasta
steps: Get a large pot, fill it with water, heavily salt it, and bring it to a boil.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Cook the pasta in boiling water until al dente.
Cut the skin of the bratwurst and open the ground beef package.
Preheat a cast iron skillet on high heat.
Cook the beef and bratwurst in the skillet until browned thoroughly.
Strain the pasta, reserving 1/2-1 cup of pasta water.
Shred all of the cheddar cheese.
Add the tomato sauce to the skillet, using a bit of pasta water to get all the sauce out of the jar.
Gradually mix in half of the shredded cheese into the sauce.
Rehydrate the pasta with the reserved pasta water in a large pot.
Ladle the pasta sauce into the pot, mixing after every 2-3 ladles.
Grab a large oven-safe dish or multiple small oven-safe pans.
Layer pasta, cheese, and pasta, saving a cup of cheese for later.
Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes.
Set the oven to broil, top with 1.5 handfuls of cheese, and broil until melted thoroughly.

trailPudding.title: Trail Pudding
steps: To easily measure out the water on the trail, put a line 3 and 1/4 inches from the bottom of a normal sandwich bag.
Mix the powders in the bag.
On the trail, add water to the line on the bag. It should be about 1 cup of water.

mountain_dew_cake.title: Mountain Dew Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line an 8x8 pan with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, stir together the baking mix, sugar, Mountain Dew, egg, and vanilla extract until smooth and well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 35–40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let cool slightly before serving.

mountain_dew_frosting.title: Mountain Dew Frosting
steps: In a medium bowl, beat the softened butter until creamy.
Gradually add the powdered sugar, mixing well after each addition.
Add Mountain Dew 1 tablespoon at a time until the frosting reaches your desired consistency.
Mix in the vanilla extract until smooth.
Spread the frosting evenly over the cooled Mountain Dew cake.
